description:
Issue reported by one of our users in our Trusty/Icehouse controller + Precise/Havana compute + nova-network cloud:

---
If I put the instance into rescue mode:
 $ nova rescue 598ec2ba-9d87-484d-ae3a-4661b4be3d91

And then *immediately* try to ssh in:
 $ ssh <email address hidden> -i ~/.ssh/some_key.pem

I get no errors, but even if I get a connection refused message, the instance does not go into rescue mode properly.

However, if I put the instance into rescue mode:
 $ nova rescue 598ec2ba-9d87-484d-ae3a-4661b4be3d91

And then wait until Nova list tells me that the instance is in rescue mode:
 $ nova list
+--------------------------------------+---------+--------+------------+-------------+-------------------+
| ID                                   | Name    | Status | Task State | Power State | Networks          |
+--------------------------------------+---------+--------+------------+-------------+-------------------+
| 598ec2ba-9d87-484d-ae3a-4661b4be3d91 | tester2 | RESCUE | -          | Running     | public= |
+--------------------------------------+---------+--------+------------+-------------+-------------------+

& only then ssh in, everything is sweetness and light.

So to my untrained eye, it would appear that eagerly ssh'ing in to the instance is affecting the rescue operation.
---


Console log for the instance shows:

An error occurred while mounting /mnt.
keys:Press S to skip mounting or M for manual recovery

Looks like it failed to mount the rescue disk partition at /dev/vda1 and instead mounts /dev/vdb1 as the root disk, which is the disk from the original instance being rescued:

Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
/dev/vdb1       9.8G  833M  8.4G   9% /

I can mount /dev/vda1 to /mnt manually and it looks like an untouched ubuntu image.
title: nova rescue fails if connection made before RESCUE state

comments.content:
> I get no errors, but even if I get a connection refused message, the instance does not go into rescue mode properly.

What do you mean by "does not go into rescue mode properly" ?  What indication of problems do you get from it ?   What does 'nova list' show after the ssh attempt

Also what hypervisor are you experiancing this with ?  If libvirt, can you provide the 'virsh dumpxml GUESTNAME' of the instance when it is in the rescued state.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~berrange

comments.content: I should say I'm pretty sceptical that attempting to establish an SSH connection to the IP address of the instance could have any effect at all on the rescue process that Nova performs.
